description: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (n>=1; 1<=k<=n) is the number of permutations of [n] in which the longest increasing run has length k.
references: F. N. David, M. G. Kendall and D. E. Barton, Symmetric Function and Allied Tables, Cambridge, 1966, p. 261, Table 7.4.1.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
Max A. Alekseyev, On the number of permutations with bounded run lengths, arXiv preprint arXiv:1205.4581, 2012. - From _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 23 2012
D. W. Wilson, Extended tables for A008304 and A064315
formula: E.g.f. of column k: 1/Sum_{n>=0} ((k+1)*n+1-x)*x^((k+1)*n)/((k+1)*n+1)! - 1/Sum_{n>=0} (k*n+1-x)*x^(k*n)/(k*n+1)!. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 13 2013T(n,k) = A122843(n,k) for k > n/2. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 17 2013
maple: b:= proc(u, o, t, k) option remember; `if`(t=k, (u+o)!,      `if`(max(t, u)+o<k, 0, add(b(u+j-1, o-j, t+1, k), j=1..o)+      add(b(u-j, o+j-1, 1, k), j=1..u)))    end:T:= (n, k)-> b(0, n, 0, k) -b(0, n, 0, k+1):seq(seq(T(n,k), k=1..n), n=1..15);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 16 2013
